title: Amazon Fba Product Research (No Experience)
job_overview:
Schedule: Monday to Friday, 8 PM to 4 AM EST
Compensation: 350/month 

Do not apply if:

You currently work for another Amazon seller
You use lead lists, Facebook groups, or recycled leads
You rely on ChatGPT or AI-generated answers (we verify recordings using AI)
You cannot commit to our schedule or follow instructions carefully

Requirements:

Fluent in English
Stable internet connection (Cloudflare Speed Test screenshot required)
High attention to detail
Willing to learn and follow SOPs independently and within a team
Time Doctor must be installed and active throughout the shift
Include the word "Probation" in your subject line or your application will be ignored

To apply, send the following:

Resume in PDF format
A screenshot of your Cloudflare speed test
A voice or video recording answering all 9 questions below
Voice or video recording — answer these questions:

-What interests you about Amazon product research, and why do you think you're a good fit for learning this skill from scratch?
-Have you used any online research tools before? If not, are you comfortable learning tools like Keepa and SellerAmp SAS without relying on step-by-step coaching?
-If you were given basic guidelines and examples, how would you go about finding profitable products without copying others or using lists?
-How do you keep yourself organized when learning something completely new that involves a lot of data and repetition?
-Have you used Google Sheets or Excel before? If not, how do you plan to quickly become confident using them to track leads and performance?
-What is your availability, and are you fully committed to working our shift with no overlap with other jobs or Amazon clients?
-Tell me about a time you had to learn something fast on your own. What was the situation, and what steps did you take?
-How do you keep yourself focused during repetitive or solo tasks without someone constantly checking your work?
-When you're working alone, what personally drives you to keep going — even when things feel repetitive or slow?

You’ll be contacted with an interview link if your application passes our initial review.
